channel.title: Character look rep ++

item.title: Character look rep ++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

The player look (or appearance) is sent by the client via packet 101.

What you’re seeing in the server is the default look (a cheap hack really). However, there is no “Default” look in the vanilla. The player is merely “invisible”, and when the server receives packet 101, the player’s appearance is set.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“lostmyphat, post:3, topic:425845”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=528502.msg3854482#msg3854482 date=1324249706]
not swearing by it…but there may be a set default in the client …because when you first open the interface you always see the tehnoobshow look

I will look around for it
[/quote]

Thank you. I have to get off for now but if you could pm me, I would be very happy. This is very irritating. I’ve tried loading different sources through my same client also, and it has a different look so it can’t be client sided.[/quote]mmk thanks for that info now I won’t take hours pulling out my hair I’ll find it lol

item.title: Character look rep ++
item.dc:creator: @lostmyphat lostmyphat
item.description:
@lostmyphat wrote:

This is when you first start off and make an account, it automatically sets your character to this look if you don’t change it on the interface. How do I change it?

I thought this was it in player.java

// Setting player standard look playerLook[0] = 19; playerLook[1] = 19; playerLook[2] = 19; playerLook[3] = 19; playerLook[4] = 19; playerLook[5] = 19;

But it wasn’t. I tried changing all the values and still no luck.

Read full topic
